bioghist.p: Walter Slavin was Senior Scientist at Perkin-Elmer and the co-editor of Spectrochimica Acta Part B: Atomic Spectroscopy (SAB) until 2001. He was a graduate in 1949 of the University of Maryland in Physics and Mathematics. In 1962 he began a technical journal, the Atomic Absorption Newsletter (now called Atomic Spectroscopy), for communicating new information in the field. Slavin worked with and corresponded extensively with Alan Walsh, who developed the technique of atomic absorption spectroscopy to replace the older method of flame emission for quantitative analysis. Walsh worked at CSIRO (Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organization), Australia's national science agency.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains records of Slavin's time as editor of SAB and of his work at Perkin-Elmer and at Bonaire Technologies. The collection includes: incoming and outgoing correspondence; general files on the history of atomic absorption spectroscopy, and other chemical instrumentation; clippings of articles on the corporate history of Perkin-Elmer; slides, papers, and handouts from various workshops and talks given by Slavin; printed reports from CSIRO, the Marine Analytical Chemistry Studies Program of the National Research Council of Canada, and other research groups; correspondence with Walsh; and records of Perkin-Elmer projects.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
